notes.body: Hello Ganesh,    Greetings from PharmEasy!  We understand your concern in regard to order #645677091984781312-66160.      A refund of Rs. 1218.44 was initiated to your account on 07.11.2025. Post initiation, the refund will be credited to your source account within 5-7 business days. Please note that Saturday, Sunday, and bank holidays are not included in this.    Please note that the refund might not be shown in the UPI account and the same is credited to your bank account.If you still have not received the refund, please contact us by sharing your bank statement in PDF format from 07.11.2025 till date to check further.   For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels on the app or website listed in the "Need Help" section.  Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Safe.  Regards, PharmEasy
notes.body_html:
Hello Ganesh,

We understand your concern in regard to order #645677091984781312-66160.

A refund of Rs. 1218.44 was initiated to your account on 07.11.2025. Post initiation, the refund will be credited to your source account within 5-7 business days. Please note that Saturday, Sunday, and bank holidays are not included in this.
Please note that the refund might not be shown in the UPI account and the same is credited to your bank account.If you still have not received the refund, please contact us by sharing your bank statement in PDF format from 07.11.2025 till date to check further.

notes.body: Hello Domnika,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     We understand you wish to permanently delete your account with PharmEasy. We would be unable to delete the account from our database. We have to produce/show any or all transactions or interactions, past or present, when asked for by relevant governmental authorities.     Please note that once the account is deactivated, we are unable to process any requests or reactivate the account.     Once your request has been processed in the system, our agent will call within 24 to 48 hours on a registered mobile number and confirm if you have requested account deactivation. After verification, an OTP will be sent to your registered mobile number. Once the OTP is verified, the agent will go ahead and deactivate your account      Kindly confirm so that we can proceed with the request.     Awaiting your earliest response.     Regards,  Habiba
notes.body_html:
Hello Domnika,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

We understand you wish to permanently delete your account with PharmEasy. We would be unable to delete the account from our database. We have to produce/show any or all transactions or interactions, past or present, when asked for by relevant governmental authorities.

Please note that once the account is deactivated, we are unable to process any requests or reactivate the account.

Once your request has been processed in the system, our agent will call within 24 to 48 hours on a registered mobile number and confirm if you have requested account deactivation. After verification, an OTP will be sent to your registered mobile number. Once the OTP is verified, the agent will go ahead and deactivate your account

Kindly confirm so that we can proceed with the request.

Awaiting your earliest response.

Regards,
Habiba

notes.body: Hello Sunil,         Greetings from PharmEasy!  This email is in regard to order #654137844358971392-20956.     A refund of Rs. 3155.52 was initiated to your account on 07.12.2025. Post initiation, the refund will be credited to your source account within 5-7 business days. Please note that Saturday, Sunday, and bank holidays are not included in this.    A Promotional cashback of Rs. 100 is credited to your PharmEasy wallet. To check your PharmEasy Wallet balance, go to the accounts section and click on the Wallet section to see the balance amount. Rs. 50 will expire on 31.01.2026 at 1:00 PM, and the balance Rs. 50 will expire on 30.05.2026 at 11:59 PM.    We apologise for the inconvenience caused to you.   For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels on the app or website listed in the "Need Help" section.  Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Safe.  Regards, PharmEasy
notes.body_html:
Hello Sunil,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

This email is in regard to order #654137844358971392-20956.

A refund of Rs. 3155.52 was initiated to your account on 07.12.2025. Post initiation, the refund will be credited to your source account within 5-7 business days. Please note that Saturday, Sunday, and bank holidays are not included in this.
A Promotional cashback of Rs. 100 is credited to your PharmEasy wallet. To check your PharmEasy Wallet balance, go to the accounts section and click on the Wallet section to see the balance amount. Rs. 50 will expire on 31.01.2026 at 1:00 PM, and the balance Rs. 50 will expire on 30.05.2026 at 11:59 PM.
We apologise for the inconvenience caused to you.

For any further assistance, please reach out to us through our support channels on the app or website listed in the "Need Help" section.

Thank you for choosing PharmEasy. Stay Safe.

Regards,
PharmEasy

notes.body: Hello Meetshah,     Greetings from PharmEasy!     I understand your concern related to the order #654368163997679616-17309. Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused.     Before raising a returned request, I would request you set the refund preference so that the refund is initiated into the payment source or else the refund will be credited to your PharmEasy wallet.     You can set refund preferences in your App or on the website based on the Mode of Payment that you select for your orders.     Click on the link to set the refund preference:  https://pharmeasy.in/account/profile/refunds    Once you set the refund preference, you can connect back to us and we will take action accordingly.     Kindly share the images of the product in JPEG or PNG format with the (PharmEasy QR code) barcode (white color sticker) and the batch number (MRP and Manufacturer details) so that we can take further action.     Awaiting your response.     Regards, Manisha

Hello Meetshah,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

I understand your concern related to the order #654368163997679616-17309. Please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused.

Before raising a returned request, I would request you set the refund preference so that the refund is initiated into the payment source or else the refund will be credited to your PharmEasy wallet.

You can set refund preferences in your App or on the website based on the Mode of Payment that you select for your orders.

Click on the link to set the refund preference:
https://pharmeasy.in/account/profile/refunds
Once you set the refund preference, you can connect back to us and we will take action accordingly.

Kindly share the images of the product in JPEG or PNG format with the (PharmEasy QR code) barcode (white color sticker) and the batch number (MRP and Manufacturer details) so that we can take further action.

Awaiting your response.

Regards,
Tahera

notes.body: Hello Gopal,  Greetings from PharmEasy!  With regards to your order #650188804548374528-35570, I see the requested medicine SITARED M 50/500MG STRIP OF 15 TABLETS was unavailable with our partner retailer. Hence, it was removed from your order to ensure rest all the medicines are delivered to you.  I assure you that this change in your order has occurred only if the Partner Retailer has exhausted all possible alternatives to source the unavailable medicine.  Your refund of Rs. 486.45 was initiated on 21st November 2025. You will receive the refund to your payment source within 5 to 7 business days. You can track your refund via ARN number: 814048791028.  Please note, at the time of placing the order, the requested medicine was available in limited quantity, and you were able to add medicines to the order. Once the medicine was added to your order, our Partner Retailer tried to arrange the medicine from every possible source. However, they could not arrange one.  The News Explained

Cyclone-fueled rain has brought intense flooding to Southeast Asia. Sri Lanka was struck by a separate storm  Cyclone Ditwah  which triggered landslides and widespread damage. 
 
In India, it is the season for air pollution. Both Delhi and Mumbai are struggling with poor AQI. 
 
The other must-read stories are 
 
 The takeaways from Elon Musks podcast interview with Nikhil Kamath

 Heavy rainfall triggered by tropical storms such as Cyclone Ditwah, Typhoon Koto, and Cyclone Senyar has unleashed widespread flooding and landslides across Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Thailand, Vietnam and Malaysia. The extreme weather has claimed the lives of over 1,000 people already, with hundreds of others still missing. Is climate change to blame for this watery chaos?

helpdesk_ticket.description_html:
View in browser
The News Explained
01, Dec 2025
Dear readers,

You are reading the Firstpost newsletter, The News Explained. After the weekend break, like you, we are back to business. In todays edition, we talk about the devastating floods in Asia that have hit Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Thailand, Malaysia, and Vietnam. More than 1,000 people have died, with many still missing. Cyclone-fueled rain has brought intense flooding to Southeast Asia. Sri Lanka was struck by a separate storm Cyclone Ditwah which triggered landslides and widespread damage.

In India, it is the season for air pollution. Both Delhi and Mumbai are struggling with poor AQI.

The other must-read stories are

  • The takeaways from Elon Musks podcast interview with Nikhil Kamath

  • Who could be the next Fed chief?

  • What is Oxfords Word of the Year?
1

Water-pocalyse in parts of Asia: Why are floods that claimed 1,000 lives so deadly?

Heavy rainfall triggered by tropical storms such as Cyclone Ditwah, Typhoon Koto, and Cyclone Senyar has unleashed widespread flooding and landslides across Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Thailand, Vietnam and Malaysia. The extreme weather has claimed the lives of over 1,000 people already, with hundreds of others still missing. Is climate change to blame for this watery chaos?
Read Full Article
2

Mumbai vs Delhi: Which city has the more toxic air?

Indias two major metro cities are choking. The air in Delhi and Mumbai is toxic, as a thick layer of smog envelops both. While Graded Response Action Plan-4 restrictions have been imposed in several areas of Mumbai, Grap-3 was revoked in the national capital last week despite its worst air quality. But what makes the Indian capital more polluted?
Read Full Article
3

H-1B visas, Indian connection, future of jobs What Elon Musk revealed in podcast with Nikhil Kamath

What does Elon Musk think about the world and its current events? Thats what Nikhil Kamath, the famous podcaster and co-founder of Zerodha, asked the worlds richest man during a nearly two-hour conversation. The discussion covered everything under the sun, including the SpaceX CEOs opinions on Indians in the US, as well as his predictions about the future of working
Read Full Article
4

Who will replace Jerome Powell as US Fed Chair as Trump nears his final choice?

US President Donald Trump is preparing to select the next chair of the US Federal Reserve. The White House has narrowed its search to five contenders, and they could reshape American monetary policy for years. Jerome Powells term is ending in 2026, and internal divisions over rate cuts are growing
Read Full Article
5

What is rage bait, the Oxford 2025 Word of the Year?

Its often used in internet-speak. Rage bait is defined as online content deliberately designed to elicit anger or outrage by being frustrating, provocative or offensive to drive engagement. It is named by the Oxford University Press as the Word of the Year
Read Full Article

notes.body: Hello Ramesh,      Greetings from PharmEasy!     I understand your concern with regard to the doctor's name in the invoice. I will surely assist you with this.     You also have an option to place an order via prescription, so the doctor's name will be mentioned as per the prescription. You may follow the steps below to place an order by prescription.      Click on Order Medicine - Order via Prescription.  Upload a prescription and proceed to checkout.  Select a delivery address or add a new address.  Select the payment method and place an order.      If your concern is related to any order, kindly share the order ID. I will be more than happy to check your order and assist you further.     Awaiting your response.     Regards,  Sandhya Nackwal
notes.body_html:
Hello Ramesh,

Greetings from PharmEasy!

I understand your concern with regard to the doctor's name in the invoice. I will surely assist you with this.

You also have an option to place an order via prescription, so the doctor's name will be mentioned as per the prescription. You may follow the steps below to place an order by prescription.

  • Click on Order Medicine - Order via Prescription.
  • Upload a prescription and proceed to checkout.
  • Select a delivery address or add a new address.
  • Select the payment method and place an order.

If your concern is related to any order, kindly share the order ID. I will be more than happy to check your order and assist you further.

Awaiting your response.

Regards,
Sandhya Nackwal
